article:
The 'Central Rabbinical Congress' (in full: 'Central Rabbinical Congress of the
U.S.A. and Canada', commonly abbreviated to 'CRC'; in Hebrew: Hisachdus
HaRabbonim DeArtzos HaBris VeCanada ××ª×××××ª ××¨×× ××) is a rabbinical organization
that is a consortium of various Orthodox Jewish groups including the Satmar
Hasidic group. [http://www.forward.com/articles/10054/ Forward] It
also provides kosher food certification, and is well known for being strongly
anti-Zionist. It is identified with the most conservative wings of Haredi
Judaism in America.

In 1953, Rabbi Joel Teitelbaum founded the association.

The CRC has close relations with the Edah HaChareidis of Jerusalem, and can be
closely compared to it, representing the same conservative wings of the Haredi
world that the Edah represents in Jerusalem. In the past, both institutions were
headed by the Satmar Rebbes, Rabbis Joel Teitelbaum and Moshe Teitelbaum. [http://www.rickross.com/reference/ultra-
orthodox/ultra67.html Jerusalem Post]

The CRC serves as a religious court whose typical cases deal with marital and
business disputes in the Satmar, Pupa, and Satmar affiliated chasidic communiti-
es. [http://www.thejewishweek.com/news/newscontent.php3?artid=11412 The
Jewish Week]

In 1986 the CRC publicized the following declaration: It is our duty
to denounce those who invoke the name of the Almighty in vain. It is our holy
obligation and our moral responsibility to call on them: Stop using these
falsehoods and heresies to justify yourselves and your misdeeds. The Jewish
faith, as transmitted by the Almighty to our forefathers has not and will never
countenance the zionist and nationalistic doctrines of the state of Israel.
These false doctrines are compounded of atheism and anti-religious zionism,
ideologies alien to Judaism. Let them not be misrepresented to the world as
Jewish. [http://www.mepc.org/journal/9012_corrigan.asp Middle East Policy
Council, Journal, Winter 1990-91, Number 35: JEWISH CRITICISM OF ZIONISM, Edward
C. Corrigan]
